instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01521: What is 820-01521? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - dead
threads.message:
Board is perfect, no oxidation or short.

It has 20v and draws 0.2a from the source (without battery). Trackpad has click. In DFU mode, I tried Revive and Restore, both complete without error and Configurator gets padlocked.

Audio card is perfect, but I tried to connect with it disconnected, it didn't work either.

I disconnected the display and put an external monitor, there is no image either.

Any tips?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - dead
threads.message:
What error do you get on DFU?
Any S5, RAM, or PCH voltage comes on?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - dead
threads.message:
No error in DFU mode. It completes the revive and restore process.

I have the S5 line voltages

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - dead
threads.message:
No other coils get voltage?
Check them in diode mode then.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - dead
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - dead
threads.message:
If DFU didn't help, probably bad CPU.
All other voltages present, but missing CPU core.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01521</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> - dead
